sentences.en: Aviation was lamentably weak and primitive.
sentences.cn: 航空设施极其薄弱简陋.

sentences.en: He devoted all his life to China's aviation.
sentences.cn: 他的一生都奉献给了中国的航空事业。

sentences.en: It's believed the affair was potentially harmful to British aviation.
sentences.cn: 据信该事件可能对英国航空业造成不利影响。

sentences.en: Pilots in the early days of aviation flew by the seat of their pants.
sentences.cn: 在人类从事航空的初期,飞行员全凭直觉飞行.

sentences.en: Pilots of large aircraft are masters of aviation.
sentences.cn: 大型飞行器的驾驶员是航空学方面的专家.

sentences.en: Ten years ago, they began to develop the aviation ( industry ).
sentences.cn: 十年前, 他们开始发展航空工业.

sentences.en: Ten years ago, they began to develop the aviation industry.
sentences.cn: 十年前，他们开始发展航空工业。

sentences.en: The airline's biggest headache is the increase in the price of aviation fuel.
sentences.cn: 令航空公司最头痛的事就是航空燃料价格的上涨。

sentences.en: The civil aviation minister ordered all the planes to be grounded.
sentences.cn: 民航部长下令所有飞机不得起飞。

sentences.en: The Gossamer Conder, a human - powered airplane, flew into aviation history on Aug. 23,1977.
sentences.cn: 1977年8月23日, “飘忽秃鹰”式人力飞机载入了航空史册.

sentences.en: The man had genius and had made his mark in the aviation world.
sentences.cn: 这人很有天赋，在航空界非常出名。

sentences.en: The Wright brothers pioneered in early aviation.
sentences.cn: 莱特兄弟是早期航空的先驱.
他们曾作为早期航空的先驱.

sentences.en: Time and time again in the history of aviation, " the impossible " has been done.
sentences.cn: 在航空史上, 这样 “ 不可能 ” 的事一再发生.

sentences.en: To overcome these obstacles has always been and continues to be a major challenge to aviation.
sentences.cn: 怎样克服这些障碍,过去经常是,而且现在仍然是航空界的重要难题.

phrases.tran_cn: 航空事故；飞机失事；飞行事故
喷气机用煤油，航空煤油
n. 航空医学；空间医学
通用航空；专用航空；普通航空业

trans.tran_en: the science or practice of flying in aircraft
